page.title: 09Kirkconnel:St.Conal's Church
page.content: St.Conal's Church( Of Scotland ) was built in 1729 with an extension being made in 1896. The original St. Conal's whose ruins lie to the north of Kirk- connel at NS71,0272.3/0615.1 dates to the 6th Century, St.Conal having been a disciple of St.Kentigern(also known as St. Mungo). The present church,under the charge of the Reverand Harold Mudaliar also accomodates the former congregation of St. Mark's which served Kelloholm until falling attendance forced an amalgamation of the two. Over the last two years the attendance has increased and now is at a healthy level.The church organises a variety of clubs; Young Worshipper's League, Bible Club, Girl's Brigade,Boy's Brigade,Young Women's Club.Mr.Mudaliar is Chaplain to Kelloholm Pr. School. He spends much time visiting his parishioners.
